title: Back in class, Russian students get a lesson from Professor Putin
description: On the first day of the new school year, the Kremlin steps up the militarization of Russian education, aimed at shaping a new generation for war.

title: In photos: The scene as Typhoon Saola heads towards Hong Kong
description: Hong Kong grounded flights, shut down its stock market and closed schools on Friday.

title: Mohamed al-Fayed, tycoon whose son died with Princess Diana, dies at 94
description: The Egyptian businessman felt scorned by Britain but owned icons such as Harrods.

title: Ukraine says it has manufactured and fired a long-range missile
description: A domestically produced missile would give Ukraine the ability to strike targets in Russia without using weapons donated by the West..

title: With wary eye on China, U.S. moves closer to former foe Vietnam
description: Vietnam and the United States will debut a “comprehensive strategic partnership,” boosting economic and tech ties amid Beijing’s aggressiveness.

title: Spain’s women’s team is finally being heard after years of being ignored
description: Spanish society finally seems fed up with the lack of respect for female players.

title: Ukraine objects after Russia and Belarus invited back to Nobel ceremonies
description: Ambassadors of Russia and its ally Belarus will be invited back to the Nobel Prize ceremonies after the foundation barred them last year over the Kremlin’s war in Ukraine.

title: Ukraine live briefing: Zelensky touts new Ukrainian-made long-range weapons
description: The Ukrainian leader said a new Ukrainian-made weapon successfully hit a target 700 kilometers, or 435 miles, away.

title: Egypt aspired to be a natural gas powerhouse. Now the lights are out.
description: Analysts say Egypt was overzealous in its drive to produce and export natural gas, contributing to rolling blackouts across Cairo this summer.

title: Amid a wave of West African coups, France faces a reckoning
description: The recent coups in Africa share an inescapable common denominator: the prevalence of anti-French sentiment driving a rejection of the political status quo.
